# Adding a Video to a Scene

**Article**

Play video in your scene by adding a video node.

## Overview

A video node renders a video at a given size and location in your scene with no exposed player controls. You might use a video node to animate visual behaviors that would be expensive to define using a collection of textures.

Be aware that a video node offers only a subset of the features available to the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKSpriteNode] class. The following are a video node’s relevant limitations:

- A video node is always scaled proportionally.
- A video node cannot be colorized. However, it can be added as a child of a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKEffectNode] to add Core Image filters for color treatments and other effects.
- A video node always uses an alpha blend mode.
- A video node cannot use custom shaders or lighting.

When a video node is created, its [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKVideoNode/size] property is initialized to the base size of the video content, but you can change it. The video content is automatically stretched to the new size. As with a sprite node, the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKVideoNode/anchorPoint] property defines where the content is displayed relative to the node position.

The following code initializes the video node using a video file stored in the app bundle and then adds the node to the scene. It calls the node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKVideoNode/play()] method to start the video playback.



You control playback using the node’s [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKVideoNode/play()] and [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKVideoNode/pause()] methods.

If you need more precise control over the video playback behavior, you can use AVFoundation to create an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayer] object for your video content and then use this object to initialize the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKVideoNode] node. Then, instead of using the node’s playback methods, you use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayer] object to control playback. The video content is automatically displayed in the video node. For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/AudioVideo/Conceptual/AVFoundationPG/Articles/00_Introduction.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40010188].
